On November 3, Regalado was elected Miamiâs 33rd Mayor with a 72% margin. He keeps his promise he would lower his salary by $50,000 as well as reducing his pension by 25%.
  +   +
On July 28, the ''Miami New Times'' published an article about Regalado's administration continuous hiring and overspending of city budget despite the city's hiring freeze; a bit over 700 new hires since the hire freeze of May 2009.
  +
Some of the new staff include Angel Zayon ($70,000-per-year), Madelin Pacheco ($67,000-per-year <ref name="test"> [http://web.me.com/alcrespo1/Site_3/MADELIN_PACHECO.html] </ref> ), Richard LaBella (80,000-per-year), among others. According to the article, neither Zayon or LaBella hold a higher education degree.<ref name="test2"> [http://www.miaminewtimes.com/2011-07-28/news/recall-tomas-regalado/] </ref>
